document.title: The Fourier transform of holomorphic functions

para.p:
For
∈ f
⁢
L 1
( R )
, define

Math.text: formulae@(widehat@(f) * xi = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * f * x * differential-d@(x)), xi element-of R)

para.p:
For
> a 0
, write

Math.text: S _ a = conditional-set@(z element-of C, absolute-value@(Im * z) less a)

para.p:
We define
F a
to be the set of functions
f
that are holomorphic on
S a
and for which there is some
> A 0
such that

Math.text: formulae@(absolute-value@(f * (x + i * y)) less= A / (1 + x ^ 2), x + i * y element-of S _ a)

para.p:
For example, for
=
⁢ f
( z )
e
-
⁢ π
z 2
,

Math.text: absolute-value@(f * z) = absolute-value@(e ^ (- pi * (x + i * y) ^ 2)) = absolute-value@(e ^ ((- pi * x ^ 2 - 2 * pi * i * x * y) + pi * y ^ 2)) = e ^ (- pi * x ^ 2) * e ^ (pi * y ^ 2)

para.p:
and for any
> a 0
,
∈ f
S a
.
The following is from Stein and Shakarchi. 1 1 footnote 1 Elias M. Stein and Rami Shakarchi, Complex Analysis, p. 114, Theorem 2.1.

p.text:
If
> a 0
and
∈ f
F a
, then for any
0 ≤ b < a
,

Math.text: formulae@(widehat@(f) * xi = e ^ (- 2 * pi * absolute-value@(xi) * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * f * (x - ((i cdot sgn) * xi) cdot b) * differential-d@(x)), xi element-of R)

para.p:
If
= b 0
then the claim is immediate. If
0 < b < a
, we define
=
⁢ g
( z )
⁢
e
-
⁢ 2 π i ξ z
f
( z )
. Because
∈ f
F a
there is some
> A 0
such that
f
satisfies (). We prove the claim separately for
≥ ξ 0
and
≤ ξ 0
. For
≥ ξ 0
, with
> R 0
,

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ (- R - i * b)) ^ (- R))@(g * z * differential-d@(z))) less= ((integral _ (- R - i * b)) ^ (- R))@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * z) * f * z) * differential-d@(z))
absolute-value@(((integral _ (- R - i * b)) ^ (- R))@(g * z * differential-d@(z)))
absent less= ((integral _ (- R - i * b)) ^ (- R))@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * z) * f * z) * differential-d@(z))
absent = ((integral _ (- b)) ^ 0)@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * ((- R) + i * y)) * f * ((- R) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = ((integral _ (- b)) ^ 0)@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * ((- R) + i * y)) * f * ((- R) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = ((integral _ (- b)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (2 * pi * xi * y) * absolute-value@(f * ((- R) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = ((integral _ (- b)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (2 * pi * xi * y) * absolute-value@(f * ((- R) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absent less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (2 * pi * xi * y) * (A / (1 + R ^ 2)) * differential-d@(y))
absent less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (2 * pi * xi * y) * (A / (1 + R ^ 2)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = O * R ^ (- 2)
absent = O * R ^ (- 2)

para.p: and likewise

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ R) ^ (R - i * b))@(g * z * differential-d@(z))) = O * R ^ (- 2)

para.p:
g
is holomorphic on
S a
, so by Cauchy’s integral theorem, taking
→ R ∞
,

Math.text: ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(g * z * differential-d@(z)) = ((integral _ (- infinity - i * b)) ^ (infinity - i * b))@(g * z * differential-d@(z))

para.p: i.e.,

Math.text: widehat@(f) * xi = ((integral _ (- infinity - i * b)) ^ (- infinity - i * b))@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * z) * f * z * differential-d@(z))
widehat@(f) * xi
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity - i * b)) ^ (- infinity - i * b))@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * z) * f * z * differential-d@(z))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (x - i * b)) * f * (x - i * b) * differential-d@(x))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (x - i * b)) * f * (x - i * b) * differential-d@(x))
absent = e ^ (- 2 * pi * xi * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * f * (x - i * b) * differential-d@(x))
absent = e ^ (- 2 * pi * xi * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * f * (x - i * b) * differential-d@(x))

para.p:
For
≤ ξ 0
, with
> R 0
,

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ ((- R) + i * b)) ^ (- R))@(g * z * differential-d@(z))) less= ((integral _ (- R)) ^ ((- R) + i * b))@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * z) * f * z) * differential-d@(z))
absolute-value@(((integral _ ((- R) + i * b)) ^ (- R))@(g * z * differential-d@(z)))
absent less= ((integral _ (- R)) ^ ((- R) + i * b))@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * z) * f * z) * differential-d@(z))
absent = ((integral _ 0) ^ b)@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * ((- R) + i * y)) * f * ((- R) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = ((integral _ 0) ^ b)@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * ((- R) + i * y)) * f * ((- R) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = ((integral _ 0) ^ b)@(e ^ (2 * pi * xi * y) * absolute-value@(f * ((- R) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = ((integral _ 0) ^ b)@(e ^ (2 * pi * xi * y) * absolute-value@(f * ((- R) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absent less= ((integral _ 0) ^ b)@(e ^ (2 * pi * xi * y) * (A / (1 + R ^ 2)) * differential-d@(y))
absent less= ((integral _ 0) ^ b)@(e ^ (2 * pi * xi * y) * (A / (1 + R ^ 2)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = O * R ^ (- 2)
absent = O * R ^ (- 2)

para.p: and likewise

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ R) ^ (R + i * b))@(g * z * differential-d@(z))) = O * R ^ (- 2)

para.p:
By Cauchy’s integral theorem, taking
→ R ∞
,

Math.text: ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(g * z * differential-d@(z)) = ((integral _ ((- infinity) + i * b)) ^ (infinity + i * b))@(g * z * differential-d@(z))

para.p: i.e.,

Math.text: widehat@(f) * xi = ((integral _ ((- infinity) + i * b)) ^ (infinity + i * b))@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * z) * f * z * differential-d@(z))
widehat@(f) * xi
absent = ((integral _ ((- infinity) + i * b)) ^ (infinity + i * b))@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * z) * f * z * differential-d@(z))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (x + i * b)) * f * (x + i * b) * differential-d@(x))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (x + i * b)) * f * (x + i * b) * differential-d@(x))
absent = e ^ (2 * pi * xi * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * f * (x + i * b) * differential-d@(x))
absent = e ^ (2 * pi * xi * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * f * (x + i * b) * differential-d@(x))

p.text:
If
> a 0
and
∈ f
F a
, then for any
0 ≤ b < a
there is some
B
such that

Math.text: formulae@(absolute-value@(widehat@(f) * xi) less= B * e ^ (- 2 * pi * b * absolute-value@(xi)), xi element-of R)

para.p:
Because
∈ f
F a
there is some
> A 0
such
f
satisfies (). Put

Math.text: B = A * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@((1 / (1 + x ^ 2)) * differential-d@(x)) = pi * A

para.p: By Theorem ,

Math.text: absolute-value@(widehat@(f) * xi) less= e ^ (- 2 * pi * absolute-value@(xi) * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * f * (x - ((i cdot sgn) * xi) cdot b)) * differential-d@(x))
absolute-value@(widehat@(f) * xi)

absent less= e ^ (- 2 * pi * absolute-value@(xi) * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * f * (x - ((i cdot sgn) * xi) cdot b)) * differential-d@(x))
absent = e ^ (- 2 * pi * absolute-value@(xi) * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(absolute-value@(f * (x - ((i cdot sgn) * xi) cdot b)) * differential-d@(x))
absent = e ^ (- 2 * pi * absolute-value@(xi) * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(absolute-value@(f * (x - ((i cdot sgn) * xi) cdot b)) * differential-d@(x))
absent less= e ^ (- 2 * pi * absolute-value@(xi) * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@((A / (1 + x ^ 2)) * differential-d@(x))
absent less= e ^ (- 2 * pi * absolute-value@(xi) * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@((A / (1 + x ^ 2)) * differential-d@(x))
absent = e ^ (- 2 * pi * absolute-value@(xi) * b) cdot B
absent = e ^ (- 2 * pi * absolute-value@(xi) * b) cdot B

para.p: Define

Math.text: F = (union _ (a > 0))@(F _ a)

para.p:
We now prove the Fourier inversion formula for functions belonging to
F
. 2 2 footnote 2 Elias M. Stein and Rami Shakarchi, Complex Analysis, p. 115, Theorem 2.2.

Math.text: formulae@(f * x = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * widehat@(f) * xi * differential-d@(xi)), x element-of R)

para.p:
Say
∈ f
F a
, write

Math.text: ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * differential-d@(xi)) = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * differential-d@(xi)) + ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * differential-d@(xi)) = I _ 1 + I _ 2

para.p:
and take
0 < b < a
. First we handle
I 1
. By Theorem , for
> ξ 0
,

Math.text: widehat@(f) * xi = e ^ (- 2 * pi * xi * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * u) * f * (u - i * b) * differential-d@(u)) = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (u - i * b)) * f * (u - i * b) * differential-d@(u))

para.p:
with which, because
>
⁢ ξ b
0
,

Math.text: ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * widehat@(f) * xi * differential-d@(xi)) = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (u - i * b)) * f * (u - i * b) * differential-d@(u)) * differential-d@(xi))
((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * widehat@(f) * xi * differential-d@(xi))

absent = ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (u - i * b)) * f * (u - i * b) * differential-d@(u)) * differential-d@(xi))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(f * (u - i * b) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (u - i * b - x)) * differential-d@(xi) * differential-d@(u)))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(f * (u - i * b) * ((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (u - i * b - x)) * differential-d@(xi) * differential-d@(u)))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(f * (u - i * b) * (1 / (2 * pi * i * (u - i * b - x))) * differential-d@(u))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(f * (u - i * b) * (1 / (2 * pi * i * (u - i * b - x))) * differential-d@(u))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ L _ 1)@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(zeta))
absent = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ L _ 1)@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(zeta))

para.p:
where
=
L 1
{
- u
⁢ i b
:
∈ u R
}
traversed left to right. Now we handle
I 2
. By Theorem , for
< ξ 0
,

Math.text: widehat@(f) * xi = e ^ (2 * pi * xi * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * u) * f * (u + i * b) * differential-d@(x)) = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (u + i * b)) * f * (u + i * b) * differential-d@(x))

para.p:
with which, because
<
⁢ ξ b
0
,

Math.text: ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * widehat@(f) * xi * differential-d@(xi)) = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (u + i * b)) * f * (u + i * b) * differential-d@(u)) * differential-d@(xi))
((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * widehat@(f) * xi * differential-d@(xi))

absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (u + i * b)) * f * (u + i * b) * differential-d@(u)) * differential-d@(xi))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(f * (u + i * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * ((u + i * b) - x)) * differential-d@(xi) * differential-d@(u)))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(f * (u + i * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ 0)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * ((u + i * b) - x)) * differential-d@(xi) * differential-d@(u)))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(f * (u + i * b) * ((- 1) / (2 * pi * i * ((u + i * b) - x))) * differential-d@(u))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(f * (u + i * b) * ((- 1) / (2 * pi * i * ((u + i * b) - x))) * differential-d@(u))
absent = - (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ L _ 2)@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(xi))
absent = - (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ L _ 2)@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(xi))

para.p:
where
=
L 2
{
+ u
⁢ i b
:
∈ u R
}
traversed left to right. Thus

Math.text: ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * widehat@(f) * xi * differential-d@(xi)) = (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ L _ 1)@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(zeta)) - (1 / (2 * pi * i)) * (integral _ L _ 2)@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(xi))

para.p:
Let
- γ R
be the rectangle starting at
-
- R
⁢ i b
, going to
- R
⁢ i b
, going to
+ R
⁢ i b
, going to
+
- R
⁢ i b
, going to
-
- R
⁢ i b
. Because this rectangle and its interior are contained in
S a
, on which
f
is holomorphic, by the residue theorem we have, for
> R
| x |
,

Math.text: (integral _ gamma _ R)@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(zeta)) = ((2 * pi * i) cdot Res _ (zeta = x)) * ((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) = ((2 * pi * i) cdot f) * x

para.p:
We estimate the integrand on the vertical sides of
γ R
. For the left side, taking
A
such that
f
satisfies (),

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ ((- R) + i * b)) ^ (- R - i * b))@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(zeta))) less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ b)@(absolute-value@((f * ((- R) + i * y)) / (((- R) + i * y) - x)) * differential-d@(y)) less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ b)@(((A / (1 + R ^ 2)) cdot (1 / (R - absolute-value@(x)))) * differential-d@(y)) = O * R ^ (- 3)

para.p: For the right side,

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ (R - i * b)) ^ (R + i * b))@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(zeta))) less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ b)@(absolute-value@((f * (R + i * y)) / ((R + i * y) - x)) * differential-d@(y)) less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ b)@(((A / (1 + R ^ 2)) cdot (1 / (R - absolute-value@(x)))) * differential-d@(y)) = O * R ^ (- 3)

para.p:
Thus, taking
→ R ∞
we get

Math.text: (integral _ L _ 1)@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(zeta)) - (integral _ L _ 2)@(((f * zeta) / (zeta - x)) * differential-d@(zeta)) = ((2 * pi * i) cdot f) * x

para.p: which by () is

Math.text: ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * x * xi) * widehat@(f) * xi * differential-d@(xi)) = f * x

para.p: proving the claim. ∎
We now prove the Poisson summation formula. 3 3 footnote 3 Elias M. Stein and Rami Shakarchi, Complex Analysis, p. 118, Theorem 2.4.

Math.text: (sum _ (n element-of Z))@(f * n) = (sum _ (n element-of Z))@(widehat@(f) * n)

para.p:
Say
∈ f
F a
, take
0 < b < a
, and for
N
a positive integer let
γ N
be the rectangle starting at
-
- N
1 2
⁢ i b
, going to
-
+ N
1 2
⁢ i b
, going to
+ N
1 2
⁢ i b
, going to
+
-
- N
1 2
⁢ i b
, going to
-
- N
1 2
⁢ i b
. Because
∈ f
F a
,
⁢ f
( z )
-
e
⁢ 2 π i z
1
is meromorphic on a region containing
γ N
and its interior, and has poles at
= z
- N
, … , N
, with residues
Thus the residue theorem gives us

Math.text: (integral _ gamma _ N)@(((f * z) / (e ^ (2 * pi * i * z) - 1)) * differential-d@(z)) = 2 * pi * i * (sum _ (absolute-value@(n) less= N))@((f * n) / (2 * pi * i)) = (sum _ (absolute-value@(n) less= N))@(f * n)

para.p:
For the left side of
γ N
, with
= z
+
-
- N
1 2
⁢ i y
,
- b
≤ y ≤ b
,

Math.text: absolute-value@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * z) - 1) = absolute-value@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * N - pi * i - 2 * pi * y) - 1) = absolute-value@(- e ^ (- 2 * pi * y) - 1) >= 1

para.p:
so, taking
> A 0
such that
f
satisfies (),

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ ((- N - 1 / 2) + i * b)) ^ (- N - 1 / 2 - i * b))@(((f * z) / (e ^ (2 * pi * i * z) - 1)) * differential-d@(z))) less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ b)@(absolute-value@(f * ((- N - 1 / 2) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absolute-value@(((integral _ ((- N - 1 / 2) + i * b)) ^ (- N - 1 / 2 - i * b))@(((f * z) / (e ^ (2 * pi * i * z) - 1)) * differential-d@(z)))
absent less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ b)@(absolute-value@(f * ((- N - 1 / 2) + i * y)) * differential-d@(y))
absent less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ b)@((A / (1 + (- N - 1 / 2) ^ 2)) * differential-d@(y))
absent less= ((integral _ (- b)) ^ b)@((A / (1 + (- N - 1 / 2) ^ 2)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = O * N ^ (- 2)
absent = O * N ^ (- 2)

para.p: Likewise,

Math.text: absolute-value@(((integral _ ((N + 1 / 2) - i * b)) ^ (N + 1 / 2 + i * b))@(((f * z) / (e ^ (2 * pi * i * z) - 1)) * differential-d@(z))) = O * N ^ (- 2)

para.p:
Therefore, taking
→ N ∞
, () becomes

Math.text: (integral _ L _ 1)@(((f * z) / (e ^ (2 * pi * i * z) - 1)) * differential-d@(z)) - (integral _ L _ 2)@(((f * z) / (e ^ (2 * pi * i * z) - 1)) * differential-d@(z)) = (sum _ (n element-of Z))@(f * n)

para.p:
where
=
L 1
{
- x
⁢ i b
:
∈ x R
}
, traversed left to right, and
=
L 2
{
+ x
⁢ i b
:
∈ x R
}
, traversed left to right. Then, as
> b 0
,

Math.text: (sum _ (n element-of Z))@(f * n) = (integral _ L _ 1)@(f * z * (e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * z) / (1 - e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * z))) * differential-d@(z)) + (integral _ L _ 2)@(f * z * (1 / (1 - e ^ (2 * pi * i * z))) * differential-d@(z))
(sum _ (n element-of Z))@(f * n)
absent = (integral _ L _ 1)@(f * z * (e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * z) / (1 - e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * z))) * differential-d@(z)) + (integral _ L _ 2)@(f * z * (1 / (1 - e ^ (2 * pi * i * z))) * differential-d@(z))

absent = (integral _ L _ 1)@(f * z * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * z) * ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * z) ^ n * d * z)) + (integral _ L _ 2)@(f * z * ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * z) ^ n))

absent = (integral _ L _ 1)@(f * z * e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * z) * ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * z) ^ n * d * z)) + (integral _ L _ 2)@(f * z * ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * z) ^ n))

absent = ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@((integral _ L _ 1)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * (n + 1) * z) * f * z * differential-d@(z))) + ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@((integral _ L _ 2)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * n * z) * f * z * differential-d@(z)))

absent = ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@((integral _ L _ 1)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * (n + 1) * z) * f * z * differential-d@(z))) + ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@((integral _ L _ 2)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * n * z) * f * z * differential-d@(z)))

absent = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * n * (x - i * b)) * f * (x - i * b) * differential-d@(x))) + ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * n * (x + i * b)) * f * (x + i * b) * differential-d@(x)))

absent = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * n * (x - i * b)) * f * (x - i * b) * differential-d@(x))) + ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * n * (x + i * b)) * f * (x + i * b) * differential-d@(x)))
absent = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * n * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * n * x) * f * (x - i * b) * differential-d@(x)))
absent = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * n * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * n * x) * f * (x - i * b) * differential-d@(x)))
+ ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * n * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * n * x) * f * (x + i * b) * differential-d@(x)))
+ ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * n * b) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * n * x) * f * (x + i * b) * differential-d@(x)))

para.p: Using Theorem this becomes

Math.text: (sum _ (n element-of Z))@(f * n) = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ infinity)@(widehat@(f) * n) + ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ infinity)@(widehat@(f) * (- n)) = (sum _ (n element-of Z))@(widehat@(f) * n)

para.p: proving the claim. ∎
Take as granted that

Math.text: formulae@(((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * e ^ (- pi * x ^ 2) * differential-d@(x)) = e ^ (- pi * xi ^ 2), xi element-of R)

para.p:
For
> t 0
and
∈ a R
, with
= y
⁢
t
/ 1 2
(
+ x a
)
,

Math.text: ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * e ^ (- pi * t * (x + a) ^ 2) * differential-d@(x)) = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (t ^ (- 1 / 2) * y - a)) * e ^ (- pi * y ^ 2) * t ^ (- 1 / 2) * differential-d@(y))
((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * x) * e ^ (- pi * t * (x + a) ^ 2) * differential-d@(x))
absent = ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * (t ^ (- 1 / 2) * y - a)) * e ^ (- pi * y ^ 2) * t ^ (- 1 / 2) * differential-d@(y))
absent = e ^ (2 * pi * i * xi * a) * t ^ (- 1 / 2) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * t ^ (- 1 / 2) * y) * e ^ (- pi * y ^ 2) * differential-d@(y))
absent = e ^ (2 * pi * i * xi * a) * t ^ (- 1 / 2) * ((integral _ (- infinity)) ^ infinity)@(e ^ (- 2 * pi * i * xi * t ^ (- 1 / 2) * y) * e ^ (- pi * y ^ 2) * differential-d@(y))

para.p:
With
=
⁢ f
( x )
e
-
⁢ π t
(
+ x a
)
2
, this shows us that

Math.text: widehat@(f) * xi = e ^ (2 * pi * i * xi * a) * t ^ (- 1 / 2) * e ^ (- pi * xi ^ 2 * t ^ (- 1))

para.p: and applying the Poisson summaton gives

Math.text: (sum _ (n element-of Z))@(e ^ (- pi * t * (n + a) ^ 2)) = (sum _ (n element-of Z))@(e ^ (2 * pi * i * n * a) * t ^ (- 1 / 2) * e ^ (- pi * n ^ 2 * t ^ (- 1)))

para.p: Define

Math.text: formulae@(vartheta * t = (sum _ (n element-of Z))@(e ^ (- pi * n ^ 2 * t)), t > 0)

para.p:
Using () with
= a 0
gives

Math.text: vartheta * t = t ^ (- 1 / 2) * vartheta * (1 / t)
